c9H3AvpD0jFROzfPComfUQ.text: Cheap forgettable food in a loud, bright atmosphere. A fork and knife in  paper bag on your table. Service is what you would expect from an overworked staff. Our waitress was pleasant but hard to find when you wanted something. The chips are tasty but so thin its impossible to dip any guac with them. The salsa is more of a Pico De Gallo than salsa you may be used to. It's fresh, tasty and has a nice little kick from fresh minced chilis. For my dinner, the beef burrito was more beans than anything else. The side of rice was dry and tasteless. I ordered a beer and I was brought a can and I had to request a glass. Maybe an ecomical fun place for a family with several kids? If your idea of a good restaurant is On The Boarder (which is much better in my opinion) or IHOP, you won't be disappointed.

Uu258ElCA9sI3vu4SnwHUQ.text: First ran into their Tex Mex 20 years ago in Austin, TX. Locals took me there. I was surprised to see the chain make it out to NC, but pleasantly so. Tasty salsa fresca, good burritos, decent chimichangas. Very acceptable chile relleno, as well (stick with the tomatillo sauce).

yQwurrrWef3mwBi-2uOzrw.text: Not a fan of it. Never have been and think I will never be. When they opened it. I tried it again and it's just another concept trying to make it big with no vision. The tortillas are way too thick. The steak tasted cheap. The presentation is not even worth the price. You are better off going to on the border and I won't even recommend anyone going there.

mEwWdCfeKRIU_1-kIfuz0w.text: Spicy salsa!!! Fun place and great atmosphere for families, quick service, relatively good food.  Not sure why the guacamole had lettuce at the bottom but it was still tasty.

q5GLdYNIeou94m8ISlXMTw.text: Our first visit to Chuy's and it won't be our last. Starting with the good news, the drinks are flavorful and the nacho car (Monday-Friday) it great. Chuy's certainly has an industrial sized ice maker as the drinks are bursting with frozen h2o!  My Bride ordered the  Quesadilla  which came in the form of 4 tacos. She was satisfied although thought the protein was a bit sparse. I ordered the Chicken burrito with the green chili sauce (3 chilis hot). While advertised as "big as your face" it is a bit of a over statement especially if you ask to omit the beans, which I did. If it is as big as they say....must be a lot of beans!!  Our waiter was very pleasant, knowledgeable and well schooled in the art of up selling. Each recommendation he made was highlighted in green, on the menu, was the most popular and coincidentally the most expensive. I fell prey to his strong recommendation of the Boom Boom sauce. It was good as I ordered a side sampler and payed $3.59 for 3 tablespoons full.  We'll be back for Happy Hour but dinner probably not!

AQLVMN3Ms0n851TVvnIMew.text: I usually don't write reviews, but I want people to know how awful this place is. The chips and salsa were the only good thing I had all night. The guacamole was bland, and made up of only a little bit of avocado with a lot of lettuce underneath it as a filler. Then, they completely messed up my order. I ordered veggie enchiladas since I'm vegetarian, and they gave me chicken enchiladas. I didn't realize it until I took a bite and it was too late. And the veggie enchiladas, one of the few vegetarian options, weren't good either. Definitely not coming here again.

T4LZ1a36HCnzWIIR-85H9w.text: Chuys has always been a favorite. This location, however, needs some help.  Food was so-so. Didn't taste at all like I was used to in other locations in VA and FL. Hopefully will improve as staff gets better training. Gave them an extra star because they were newly opened but the only thing that was good were the chips and Margaritas.

I7OPpq3HdDa37m4o71e7XQ.text: Not as good as the Austin original! I understand they just opened the service was somewhat lacking a needed more training some of the food was not consistent but overall I think it will be a great place to eat once I get everything in order.

AEPXoiUZBAXBlncNQVND3A.text: On The Border was my go to Mex place until I went to Gastonia (bad). This Chuy's recently opened on Providence Rd. Only a mile away from On The Border, it is so very much better. Hand made tortillas, great salsa, great food and, unlike On The Border.... good service. Thank you Austin, Texas for coming here.

jic8aooJGQujeEnc0fPgZQ.text: Some good and bad. First the good:  the chips and salsa selection is very good. A lot of variety of salsa to choose from. The margaritas are also very good at reasonable prices and a good selection.   Now the bad:  Food. It is bland and flavorless. My wife and I have eaten here two times and tried various dishes. All have been disappointing. Too bad because we love Mexican food and good Tex mex. this trip I ordered the steak burrito that was supposed to come with a green chili inside. The only thing inside was steak. So what I received was a flour tortilla with chunks of meat inside. Nothing else, that's it. When I asked the waitress she shrugged her shoulders and said "oh" that's funny. It should have stuff inside. My wife ordered the sampler appetizer plate so she could try a variety of items. All were bland and disappointing.  I can see how this food might appeal to many people who have not had flavorful, good Mexican food.  For me, I will come back for drinks and chips and salsa, but I will not eat here.

ROtR6kZUuxkffMw-0g6Vrg.text: Best Tex-mex food around!!! Love the patio, the decor, and the queso! If you go during the week for lunch usually there won't be a wait but prepared to wait on a Friday night!! Place is packed, with good reason though. Nacho Car during their happy hour is an awesome plus as well.

LRkisjmfTTk3jo7n7jNP4w.text: Please go elsewhere for your food. I had such high hopes for this place that fell flat. Our waitress took forever to take our order. People who came in after us had chips, salsa and their drinks before we put in our drink order. The original entree that came out was not what I ordered. The waitress returned in 10 minutes with my actual order (shrimp tacos). One of my tacos didn't have any sauce at all, the rice and the beans were lukewarm and dry. I poked around on the plate and ate what I could but left still feeling hungry. I won't be returning.

FtbWSFPmgR5-_d2WOrvJtQ.text: Two words. Food. Poisoning. I have truly never been so sick as from a night after eating chuys. It was once my absolute favorite restaurant. Be warned..

16ZW0vNEAtHW_q-y5XjdNw.text: Last time here, waiter dropped ice scoop on floor and he put it back in ice bin.

rmjK3ftotdCYfLuXo_yPZg.text: Been to Chuy's three times now. For the most part pretty standard fare for a TexMex place. Good portions on each plate. Can't tell much difference in the two rice options. The chicken is actually kinda bland in the flautas. The nachos are really good because they are not just chips tossed on a plat but rather they have attention placed on each one. The Boom Boom sauce is excellent. My biggest downside is that the last two times we've been there we had the same server and he is extremely lackluster and doesn't pay much attention to his customers. He's walked away from me twice as I was making a drink order and trying to ask for more salsa but he didn't hear because he was walking away from me. I'd definitely want a different server if I went back. Decent place and always busy but not the best Mexican food in the area.

yW0uq0ggIz9cit7KpOUX_w.text: Chuy's has the best Tex-Mex I've ever had. I've been to many locations including the original in Austin, Houston, Little Rock and the food is just as good here. I'm not sure why this one has so many bad reviews except that maybe they are still new. For those who say they have no flavor, I'm not sure what they're eating because the food here is the best. During the week they have a free nacho bar during happy hour. Our favorites are: make sure to request the creamy jalapeno dip (it's free) with your chips, tortilla soup is the best I've ever had, beef fajitas, boom boom enchiladas, shrimp & cheese relleno, Baja shrimp tacos, their refried beans are to die for, hatch green chile rice and Mexican Martini (you can ask for 2 glasses). My 5 yo son loves to get just a side order of fajita chicken, refried beans and Mexican rice. Since we moved here I've been about 3 times and the service was fine.

k4MbiTUvAi760QtNWQJi5A.text: So we have been here 2 times already. The first time we had a friend come visit us from out of town and we stopped by for some lunch. During that visit we found the staff to be friendly, the food came out quick and it was delicious. On our second visit we took our sons out for their birthday's for dinner and we had to wait over 45 minutes for an appetizer to come out and then another 20 minutes for our dinners to show up. The food was good, not as good as the first time but that is the only thing that would bring us back again. The wait staff was pretty much non-existent during our 2nd visit. The hostess had to take us to 3 different tables before she found one that was supposed to be vacant. They seemed to be totally disorganized on the 2nd visit. Hopefully the service improves as they have a good food selection and it is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States

Yv0uffrxl7Ub09vkr9Cx2g.text: Our first visit , we had excelent service throughout the entire meal!  The wait staff helped us understand the menu and the unique sauces they offer .  The food we ordered was warm and very tasty.  Thanks !

bH-vekjfA6hgbXALwdSY7Q.text: I love this place!  I'm from Texas, and I have been to them all (almost), including the original one in Austin.  After recently moving here I was so glad one opened in Charlotte.  There isn't a lot of spicy food or TexMex here, and I was really missing the heat!  I love love love the creamy jalapeno dip, but I think you have to ask for it...?  YOU MUST TRY THE CREAMY JALAPENO DIP!  I also really like the beef fajitas.  The flour tortillas are fluffy and delicious, and I always order extra.  Don't skip this place because "it's just a chain."  That's crazy!  It is a chain because it is good and they expanded.  Whoo hoo!  I have been to so called Mexican food places out here since I relocated with flour tortilla enchiladas (what!!?!), "nacho cheese dip with jalapeno" (just, NO!), and other terrible so called Mexican food abominations.  This is uniquely TexMex.  They do not claim to be authentic Mexican.  It is fun, inexpensive, and good rock n roll music to boot.  The ritas are great too.  This is the only place this homesick Texan can find good TexMex east of the Mississippi! Oh, and the Tres Leches Cake is unbelievably delicious.  Seriously, Chuy's staff, please put the creamy jalapeno dip on the table.  It is good and no one knows to ask for it.....wth......?

-OBWKfrchk5lVAHHavUmtw.text: I was so excited that this restaurant opened. I heard a lot of good things about it. The first few weeks after they opened there were long waits.   After finally eating there I don't know what the hype is all about.

zT3bA4sXR99th0lUP9s9Ew.text: I cant say enough great things about this place. It is often super packed, so come early. I love the free queso chips and taco meat that they offer during the week from 4-7.  The Jalapeno ranch is great.I have found that it is on the bar in Texas, however you must request it at the Charlotte location.  We always ask for the waiter Cam. He is excellent!  I have had the flautas and shrimp tacos. I really enjoyed the flautas more. I am looking forward to trying more things on the menu.  This is our go to Friday night spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gordita beef enchilada taco
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Taco other part of the Elvis
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Elvis

hGyH1jd4VB_eZJoQknxWBw.text: Amazing food and service. If you haven't tried the jalapeno cream sauce, it will rock your world. I ordered the southwestern enchiladas and I was very pleased. They were stacked versus rolled, and topped with a fried egg. So delicious! Very spicy and lots of flavor.   **update - I figured out the amazing service was from a guy named Ty, who I had again today on 9/22. He is absolutely amazing!!**

QvSQ0qHmsr3bqx6ZAfJAZQ.text: The chicken meat was so white and tender and clean and beautiful.  The service was fine but it was too loud for us.

c9gsFYsXRVRo56qY3wdt_Q.text: Besides the fact that the food here is just run-of-the-mill Tex-Mex, the manager present on Friday, December 15, 2017, was downright pathetic. He had no idea how to take care of a larger crowd (16) on a Friday night in which a call was made on the previous night starting out wouldn't be a problem and they would be able to work us into a section together.   We waited for 2 hours and he just continuously kept sitting other people into the empty tables that we were told would be kept together for us. If her couldn't handle the situation, which was obvious, he did not need to continue to feed us lies. We finally confronted him and demanded he seat us anywhere because he was accomplishing nothing for our benefit.   When we were seated, he told the waitress to make sure her table was taken care of immediately, but forgot to tell the waiter of the tables the same thing. By this time it wasn't important to be served quickly, but we would've liked to have been served together.   I might have gone back to this restaurant for the mediocre food, but with management like this establishment has, I am certain my money won't be spent here ever again.

M-bFX8Ew-ttGPxbCVtc6cQ.text: I hate to say this, but this wasn't something to write home about. The chip bar never got refilled and I had to ask the bartender for some more which he brought it to me in a scoop. While the queso was  good, that's all I got that was redemptive. The tacos were good but way overpriced, as was my $5 beer. The service was a tad spotty as well. Won't be back.

MgTnaNoNosyGtDkyZ-Ff0A.text: Delicious!! I always get the Baja shrimp tacos and the strawberry mojito. Service is always great, and it is a great place for kids. Free ice cream with any kids meal! Decorated very well and keeps my daughter entertained while we are there! She loves to watch them make fresh tortillas.

UXOCGuo8_Tut6ADS2rJZRg.text: We came here for the first time for a friends birthday and yes, we had a party of about 10, but good grief.   We had 2 waiters, an older man who was very friendly, efficient, and all around great.  We also had a younger girl who was obviously angry and annoyed from the second we sat down. She was rarely present and had a major attitude when she was.  When we all got our food, all I wanted was an extra plate so my husband and I could share the huge burrito he got. The waitress stood off to the side talking with another waitress, making eye contact with my husband as he tried to get her attention and ignored him for a good couple of minutes. He finally just got up and walked over to her to ask for a plate.  I kid you not, she came back with a tiny bread plate and said "this is the only one I could find." ......what???? This is a restaurant and you're trying to tell me there are NO actual plates?  I don't think I've ever had a ruder waitress. She made the already bland meal even worse. The food was extremely uneventful too. Nothing more than mediocre. I'll stick to Cantina 1511 from now on.

QdvR56-Z7bmuqJCUVke5yQ.text: Chuys isn't much to talk about for me. It's not authentic Mexican in my opinion so you have to take it for what it's worth.  The frozen margaritas & sangrias are worth a seat at the bar or in the bar area especially during the week between 4pm - 7pm where you can munch on nachos for free while you sip via the Happy Hour complimentary Nacho car. We've had take out from here once and wasn't impressed as the food lacked flavor and seasoning. My husband and I had the fish and the shrimp tacos and the batter on the seafood wasn't very tasty. Our son had the a child's chicken quesadilla which wasn't very yummy for him either. The cheese seemed to be like American cheese which isn't good cheese for a quesadilla. I returned today for some frozen margaritas with my neighbor for her birthday and we dined in at the bar. I wasn't interested in trying the good again so we stuck to the FREE nachos and ordered cocktails. I had the frozen sangria and she had the frozen raspberry margarita. ALL In ALL my fav item was the Tres Leches Yum Yum Yum did I say Yum?

Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside from Providence side of the building

waqO9L1EByLFCETIlqdTCQ.text: As much as I wanted to see this place succeed - I've been there over 30 times and they know me by name - I think this place is going down. It's a crap shoot as to whether you get what you ordered, the employees don't seem clean or careful, and I'm tired of complaining to management. Today I see that the sanitation score is 94! That's terrible. Such a shame.

Pow3CiYHqHd3JPtHW5FrfA.text: I've never had a bad experience here. The food and service is always amazing. My personal favorite is the chicka chicka boom boom enchiladas or the macho burrito Friday special as seen in the picture attached

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States

eUZi3nhZbUC2qXH1TpCYrQ.text: Their refried beans are good. The #3 we had tonight was awful. The enchilada was terrible . Nothing in it except rolled up tortilla shell with brown sauce on it. The first taco was soft and it had hardly any meat in it. So i asked for another one. It was much better.  The guacamole was tasteless. Sabors and CHipolte are much better than this overpriced restaurant. And it was freezing cold in the restaurant.

kIBuKvG--9qKAGPIM6nhOw.text: I thought it was okay in terms of Tex mex. we ordered nachos. Was not a fan of the queso dip. Have been wanting to try their nacho bar.

D6CWmJtuXLBG_16Ne38G_Q.text: Chuy's has a great, fun atmosphere but it is loud.  The have the best chips & salsa you'll find anywhere. Good, flavorful food served in a reasonable time.  The service was a little inattentive with our drink refills.  Overall good place that I would visit again.

vLCEfdvdpff6VFOMW_w2ug.text: It's such a mixed bag at this place.  The servers are so friendly, but have seen spotty service sometimes like I did tonight.  Nobody checked in on us for quite awhile, staff seemed really busy.  Perhaps understaffed?  Food is good, just wish there was more consistency in service because my view is it is hit or miss depending on the day.

p0duA2OiNp8Oju-YmU_RVQ.text: New location and it was packed.  The food was fresh and delicious.   The chips are outstanding.   So thin, they taste buttery ans seem to melt in your mouth. The dishes were good too.

gmv04uFFs5NXujoUlqVB3w.text: You can do better Mexican food at home. Quite easily. Not bad if there aren't any other options.

pXehYCrf-JmP4Sy3AV2uTQ.text: Tried Chuys with a group from work.  Understood that their gluten free menu was very limited, but decided to go since I had never been.   Ordered the #3 combo from the GF menu. Meal arrived and the enchilada was made from a flour tortilla.  Asked for corn chips, was told by the waiter, that the chips on the table were corn chips which I seriously doubted.     If looking for a place that will honor your dietary restrictions,  save your money and go somewhere else.

54pH_kZtquUm4KjJO_UCCw.text: I've been coming to Chuy's since back in the olden days when it was located all the way in Southpark. I used to travel there via my RC car. Sometimes the battery on the remote would die on my way there and I would have to phone a miniature horse to get me the rest of the way. Once Chuys moved to its new location it only became a few days away traveling by hot air balloon. I come here often when I can get my hot air balloon to start up. This place is as good as some butternut squash on a hot day. When I come here I try to see how many chips I can stuff in my body before they ask what I want as an entree so that I can leave like the cheapskate that I am. I prefer the creamy jalapeno dip here, it is fantastic. A lot better than the chunky, moldy cheese that I've had in my refrigerator for the past 2 decades :)

pbdvnxbEBTGt0S1SKnlNEA.text: Sad to say this place is hit or miss. Sometimes you get a good sever and decent food, others ( and more often)  it's an apathetic server or snarky bartender who can't mix a drink to save their life and subpar food.   You guys are gonna have to do better if you want to compete with everything else opening in this area. Start by teaching your staff to care and then teach the bartenders to be welcoming and learn how to make a margarita.   We ordered top shelf liquor (tres generaciones anejo and don julio silver, respectively, both with grand marnier) and they will remain on the table when we leave due to the bartender mixing sooooo much sweet n sour in them. Just gross. Oh, and we caught attitude from the twat mixing them because it was a half hour before closing and she wanted to socialize with her coworkers vs waiting on customers. Smh

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Build your own Texas tini.

1zqHdOHiKxNuEqgcHDasLQ.text: My family ate at Chuys for the first time tonight and we had a very enjoyable experience. The restaurant atmosphere is fun and festive, with colorful mexican decorations inside and globe lights outside. The food was good, pretty average tex-mex, but what pushed it over the top was the sauces. I had a bean and cheese burrito, which on it's own would have seemed a little plain, but paired with the creamy jalapeno sauce-worth coming back for. The highlight of the evening was definitely the service. Our server Danya was one of the best servers we have ever had.  She was friendly, yet still polite, informative and helpful. She helped us with anything we could need and she even moved our table when it started to rain (we were sitting outdoors).  We will definitely be returning, and we hope Danya will be our server!

kWhibWSRjn9AX_6CDQ2srg.text: We came here about a month ago. I didn't feel that the interior of the restaurant matched the exterior. That is, the restaurant looks really nice on the outside, very inviting. However, once inside, felt it was very, well, meh.... The inside is nothing to rave about and they have tried to give an "outdoor feel" to being inside. This usually doesn't work. Further, there are pictures on the wall of who-knows-who, and they just seemed really out of place with everything else.  The food was bland. I had the soft tacos and the beef was overcooked. The "regular salsa" was scorching hot (way too spicy). Portions were large. Nothing to write home about. Service was good and attentive. Prices were okay. Nothing really special about this place to make me want to come back.

0tNqvPGa9UIzbYBJrZ1KfA.text: I've been to Chuy's before but just not at this location. We came here on a friday night and there was a 45 min to an hour wait. Eh, ok we will wait. We sat at the bar and ordered drinks. They have a nacho bar from 4-7 and it was fantastic. That definitely made time go by fast. We probably waited about 45 mins and got sat at a booth.   Our server was very nice and gave good ideas on food. Burritos are huge and fantastic. I got the appetizer sampler. It was good. Came with an assortment of food. I noticed I had 1 quesadilla but I saw a picture on yelp for this location that someone got 2. No biggie. Salsa is very fresh. Jalapeno sauce is also good. I already have in mind of what I wanna try.   I seriously can't wait to go back!

Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. #2 Elvis combo
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. App platter-free since I brought in a pic of my dog hehe

oLLw2TBjnRQXC-Ns1Ra-Vw.text: The food was great.  The value is great.  I get the shrimp Chile relleno and chicken enchilada combo with that white/green sauce.  Everything tasted great.  My issue is the hostesses.  There was no one at the podium when I walked in, yet THREE girls (maybe HS age?) were there talking to one another.  They continued their conversation as they casually glance over at me.  I'm just standing there, waiting to be seated, but they're talking about a boy asking one of them out.  Completely rude and apathetic.  I can't imagine why the manager has these kids at the front of their establishment.  I waited a good 5 minutes before I told them that I was going to seat myself at the bar.  One grabbed a menu and escorted me.  She had an attitude the whole time.  Customer service clearing lacking.  The bartender, on the other hand, was great.  Personable, checked up on me several times, kept my drink filled...did his job & did it well. I'll go back, but I'll say something to management if those kids up front aren't doing their job.  For now, I'll vent here & hope they make some changes.

G_X4yxzNTP7nysVuoUg_kA.text: Mediocre at best. If you're wanting chain Mexican just grab some chili's. My main discount was the food tasting premade then warmed up. Atmosphere is playful and the drinks were good. Service was also top notch. It was just hard for me to get over the lackluster food when for the same price- much better, fresher food could be had. Won't be returning.

xY5K5pOxJTxr1MfA1oVqdw.text: I've been a fan of Chuy's for a few years now. I first discovered it in Orlando, and was so impressed that I went twice in my week long vacation. So once I heard there was one coming to Charlotte, I was ecstatic. I've been to this location a few times and it was average but tonight was horrible. It started off great, no wait, and the host and hostess were super friendly. The waitress came over quickly and was friendly as well. She kept our chips and salsa, along with our drink cups filled. But after this party came in beside us, it was as if we didn't exist. Our drinks didn't get filled, our requests weren't delivered and we waited, and waited. The table beside us had all of their needs met and all of ours were just forgotten. A member at my table asked for lemons to go with her water twice, I asked for Togo boxes twice, and we said we needed to place a Togo order repeatedly. Once we finally got our bills there was an error and she changed our bill AFTER we had given her our card. I understand completely fixing the error, but please inform me before you change something on my bill when you have my card in your possession. A member at our table gave cash as payment, and she gave her the incorrect change back. It seemed that there was just issue after issue with the service, which is a shame because the food was fantastic. The food is ultimately what kept me coming back all of these years, and the reason this restaurant is getting 2 stars instead of 1.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Number 1 combination

Pvi7EQ1k6QsgZqTMx6_DwQ.text: First time here tonight and definitely plan to come back! Delicious fresh tasty salsa. Chips thin warm and salty. Yummy! Ordered the Elvis Memorial Combo. Fresh hot and flavoraful! Husband ordered Steak Tacos. He enjoyed very much! Place decorated cool and love the old school music playing. Staff friendly and service good. Great Tex Mex place can not wait to go back and try another dish.

lFwqVxvSd-BrvSxqFN-mpg.text: I can't believe I didn't know this place opened right near my house sooner! I came on a Tuesday night and sat at the bar with a girlfriend. We had a great time chatting with the bartenders and owner, even though they were crazy busy. I had a frozen margarita and it was delicious and CHEAP. We ordered queso and it was to die for. For entrees, we both had the enchiladas with the boom boom sauce, it was so tasty!!! We had a great time and I was excited to come back which leads to a tale of great triumph.  I dragged my husband here on a Saturday night and since I had seen it crazy on a Tuesday I was expecting the worse. It had a crazy wait at 6:45 and we just went in to see the wait time. We were right behind a disgruntled middle aged man who dramatically hands the buzzer back to the young hostess and tells her "I give up". She politely asked if he wanted her to check his party's spot on the list. He says sure and she come back from looking at the list and I saw the most awesome thing I've ever witnessed at a hostess stand. She says so politely with a smile on her face "sir, you got here 5 minutes ago and I told you the wait was an hour and 55 minutes". He just looks at her and embarrassing leaves. You go girl! I can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. The owner told us a guy in Mexico hand makes all these fish
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Enchiladas with boom boom sauce
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy queso

2yNdp5KGg4XHVtLYeLF5nA.text: Yummy burritos! My husband and I went here for the first time and the waiter was great! The hostess wasn't to friendly. We enjoyed our meal and will definitely come back.

GMGXHxONitSj2qFwdWUDuw.text: The food here is either poorly made or microwaved from previous day's leftovers. Everything is pretty much dry or overcooked. The best dish here is probably the tres leches cake - unless your waiter gets you the corner piece, then you're back to eating dry and overcooked food. 2 stars for decent chips and salsa

Rwx-4sHDVnjH-UAb491A4Q.text: I love this place. The service is always friendly and the food is great. I wish they had some milder instead of hot sauces and food choices. The dips are good just a little spicy!

uD_QNayhYXZVmMUkTjYRUA.text: This place is literally the worst Tex-Mex restaurant in Charlotte. I tried to give this place so many chances but it just sucked over and over again. Now I understand why its original location which was located next door to Cowfish in SouthPark, shut down, because it sucks!!

r2Y2tiQ_WzkEasjA-lWrvg.text: So good! The bartender Trent was excellent, very attentive and made the best drinks. I had two drinks and an authentic quesadilla with a salad for an awesome price. I will definitely be coming back and highly recommend!!!

FhFIoOJEkA_X6eZDd-mebg.text: Chips & salsa was the absolute highlight of being here (complimentary & unlimited). The individual entrees are very very filling (yes, lots of carbs)! Honestly, one entree can be shared amongst two people because of the portion size per plate. (unless you just don't like to share, lol) Love the charro beans over refried beans. The atmosphere is quick, casual-friendly. Without a doubt, come check this place out and give your rating

36CdcDzqkAde4857kRxYKw.text: Food is mediocre but atmosphere is great for family and small kids. Service was quick and food is really cheap. Don't expect high quality but it's eatable. Tab was $67 for 6 adults entrees.

0H8DAcVIjqVfv_jOppqfiQ.text: A very helpful staff! I had a meal that didn't sit well with my stomach and I was kindly helped! They have fantastic tortillas and great chips! I would highly recommend for a great time!

Y8Q9IWoT6MszzSHLN4n-yg.text: Meh. Service was good. They made me some guacamole without onion. Great. The fajitas were not so good. They make their tortillas in house. They were undercooked and with a poor texture. The spices were strange, not typical Mexican. The rice was very poor, and the refried beans were so-so. Overall the experience was mediocre. I would try somewhere else.

kYVhpl1cULdr8BYrCmS4rw.text: Completely disrespectful. My wife and I came in and sat at the patio. Our waitress Christin came over and asked for drinks, we both got waters, she came back with them and chips and salsa and then things seemed to horribly decline.   My wife asked a simple question about a menu option (about being able to select a certain enchilada on a combo) she seemed very annoyed, rudely said "I'll make it happen." Then just walked to take my order. We both wanted Charro beans instead of refried beans but were both so distracted by the attitude, we completely forgot and she never asked what kind we wanted anyway.  Following this she never came back to refill our chips and salsa or waters, and ignored us, we watched her bring more to several other tables around us. (We know she saw we were out of everything as she looked at our table several times) We sat there with nothing left to snack on and no water. (See Pics) we literally finished the entire meal and sat around for about 15 minutes and she never once even asked or offered anything. Following our food coming out, she didn't even check back in to be sure everything was ok or that it had come out correctly.  After about 15 more minutes of sitting there trying to figure out what we could have possibly done to her, she returned with the check without asking about needing anything else, or dessert (which we originally planned on getting). At this point she did ask if we wanted boxes and we declined. When she returned with my card, she sat it down on the table next to me and said "here you go." And then walked off. No "Thank You", no nothing. So awkward.  On the bright side, the girl who ran our food out was really polite and thankfully she came because we weren't given napkins or utensils. Not sure what her name was, she seemed around 20's possibly and had several tattoos and she was great. The food was also pretty good and the space had a nice vibe, but that was crushed by our waitress who just seemed mad at the world.  Overall, the food was very good, but the service killed this place for us. And just to clarify, the restaurant was busy, but not crazy and she seemed to tend to the tables to our left and right without any trouble. We just felt very singled out for no reason, it was very strange.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Our bill from the night.
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Empty Everything for the entire meal.

oaNvmWCnCyHCXs-fYie3rQ.text: Ok option but poor, slow service and just average food. Cantina 1511 in Stone Crest is a better alternative.  Pluses: ambiance is fun, child friendly, chips and salsa, drink options but SLOW Minuses: slightly below Average Tex mex food, long waits at times, poor service.

VLlV64o9x6_ARab5my_LyA.text: Good food but not so great service and our table had a dead fly on it and the windows were filthy. Asked for a table but they would only give us a booth. Not a friendly staff at all.

oecdVgvDGMqvNRpUkZoGRw.text: First off.. I never post and if I do it is a short summary. I used to manage restaurant and understand the business. That being said......  We went for a little family fun Friday night. They are supposed to have a little cart in the bar with chips, dips and taco meat until 7pm.At 6pm the cart was barren. no queso, no salsa and the taco meat that was left was dried out.   We sat in the bar and asked if it would be restocked. They refilled some but never refilled the meat. Not the end of the world but if you offer it to attract customers don't do it 1/2 as@.  Dinner was disappointing as well. Food was fair. Hence 2 stars and not 1. The first drink from the bar took a long time and had something in it. The waitress returned it to the bar and I watched the bartender give it away to a regular sitting at the bar. (I was also walking by the bar shortly after and the bartender gave the same group another apparently free drink since he said here you go I made this by mistake.)  The food came but was hard to eat without silverware or plates. The kids taco looked horrible. After 5 minutes and cold fajitas we got silverware. A third drink that  was ordered during dinner arrived 10 minutes later when we were done   In short, average food and poor execution .

88TAPVnzmuUbOufccNKM8A.text: The chips with jalapeno ranch dip, and Margaritas are excellent!  Other than that though, I don't have a lot of other good things to say.  Typical wait time for food is quite long. If you do risk a trip there, order as quickly as you can, since their kitchen is extremely slow!  The food is pretty uninspired. The "enchilada" was some seasoned meat inside a regular tortilla, not even baked together with melted cheese on top.  The relleno was very small.  The tacos were made wrong and had to be re-made.  We have tried eating there 3 times, and have been pretty let down. We tried ordering to go, and it took forever as well.  They have some issues to work out.  Hopefully they get there.

TB47WikphQyCX5LcxDtgwQ.text: This was our first time at Chuy's.  Bri was our server and she did a great job.  I was very impressed with the entire staff.  The place was very busy, but we didn't wait for a booth. When a party left the staff quickly turned the table around for the next party.  We were regularly visited by Bri and other staff dropped by to make sure everything was okay.  This seemed like a well run operation.   This is a family restaurant.  Our party was much older than the typical patrons, but that was not a problem.    The restaurant is surprisingly large in size and is divided into several sections.  Maximum capacity was posted at around 287, as I recall.  They have a large outside open porch/dining area that would have been great if it hadn't been so cold.  Maybe next time.    I ordered the No 5, which was a chalupa and enchilada, with rice and refried beans.  There are no photos of the dishes, so I ordered strictly by the written description. When it arrived it looked like the sort of dish I would not have typically ordered, but it was fantastic.  Our party also ordered two servings of fajitas and one cheese and bean burrito.  We were all very pleased with the meals.  We will definitely be back.

55LLInwEnq6KwytVRSOCbg.text: Great margs! Always end up filling in the chips :) different days they have discounts on drinks! Great location

vonVn8_rilOpjwf3taSA7g.text: My husband and I were super excited about this restaurant opening up. We lived in Austin and ate there all the time.  Although the food at this location is good, the chuy changa being my personal favorite with the creamy jalapeno sauce, the service is still lacking. I don't believe I've ever been there no matter where I get sat, and have been given silverware and  napkins without asking for them. A place that has a free nacho bar, which I love, those are some damn good chips,  does not think it's important to give you a napkin and silverware!  And when you do ask for it, they seem surprised.   I've held off complaining about this to let the newness wear off but it's been open 8 months now, and it's still happening. Just ate there tonight.

quFS8jeA019q_uBJDD9A0w.text: This is one of my new favorite restaurant for tex mex , food so yummy  and service is good and don't forget the price it's so right on for the kind and amount of food they serve. Will definitely be back again as long as I'm visiting Charlotte.

doD85VyMiCfip-excAnlbg.text: 3rd time we've eaten here and it is going down in quality of food and service.  Ordered shrimp tacos, when they came out the second was noticeably skimpier than 1st (fewer shrimp, couple bits of cabbage, little sauce). We said something to our server and a manager came out, gave us a 3rd taco and said "I brought you another. " Ummm, thanks. Server topped off spouses club soda with water.  Everything was HOT with little flavor -- salsa, Pico de gallo, charro  beans,  etc. When we ordered dessert, they did give us a big piece of cake, though. Too many better, more authentic options to go back here.

4c-rdZ4wYBQAjfjWjF4hyw.text: Jason was bartending when I was there to celebrate my friend's 21st bday. He greeted us with a smile, was very attentive and a really nice guy. The atmosphere was awesome, very fun. The hostesses at the door were also very friendly. I'll definitely be back and next time I'm getting food!

C1PKH_2Iy-kk2Wez1WwCQw.text: Sadly we won't be back. This place always seemed to have a wait, so we strategically popped in for a late lunch. Upon arrival the hostess seriously appeared as though we were bothering her. She dumped us at a table right in front of the kitchen (seriously high traffic and the waitstaff kept knocking my purse off the back of my chair). We ultimately moved to a booth. The young lady that waited on us was sweet. VERY YOUNG, so I can let it slide that we waited a long time for her to take our order or check on us. (Seriously, we never complain about that either - but it was a noteworthy amount of time between visits to our table). The guy who filled our chips was hysterical. He appeared so angry at everyone and definitely seemed hung over - at one point he literally missed half the basket and chips were all over the table and on our laps. (Nope, he didn't even look at us to notice his mess or our chuckle). The food was fine - came out warm, was seemingly fresh, but a bit sloppy (tacos had cheese, lettuce and such falling out instead of actually just being on the side). Our little guy seriously LOVED the kid mini tacos and he cleaned up the rice and beans too, so that's something. (He never does that). If service was a bit less comically tragic, we'd consider going back - but it's ok, we figure it'll catch up eventually. This place is rocking busy and people won't tolerate that for long before Management catches on. We'll try again in the fall.

yog_eeN_3hXHqZ4gWw7Zpw.text: I've had better food at Taco Bell. I was so disappointed in the food here I don't know where to start. First off the chips were too thin for my taste. It kept breaking every time I tried to get some dip. I got one of the combos that come with chicken. enchilada and chicken chalupa. It looked almost the same as my friend's combo, who had a Taco and enchilada???? If anything my chalupa looked more like a tostada. It came with rice and beans. I told my server that I didn't eat beans he stated he would give me two sides of rice. When the food came I got beans and rice. (Honest mistake, I told the runner that gave us the food. She told me she would bring it out and we never got it) I usually eat all my food...my friend and I ate less than half of both of our foods. The only reason I'm giving them two stars is because our server was nice and refilled our cups and chips often. The nacho bar that was included with our meal was nice, though there was only three things to select from. It probably woulda been better to have salsa or hot sauce available at the bar. With that being said though, I also added points for the dips we got at the table (salsa and guacamole). Just for those two points though, I wouldn't come and eat their food again. I might come back for some drinks because they looked good but that's it lol.

3UzwRd5_PsuhY6Gf9E5OkA.text: Everything is nice, clean, the people are friendly and the food is great! What a combination! I'm so glad they decided to move to Waverly it's just another great meal we can look forward to.

djxhwbO4D24S32VUBwuzMA.text: 4 stars for Great atmosphere!!!!  But overall the food was too SPICY. We actually like hot food ,but this was so hot/not enjoyable, starting with the complementary salsa that comes with the chips on the table. We have eaten at Chuys before, and this was not the same. When we asked for less heat in the salsa, they graciously brought us different sauces that were milder.   There was WAY too much jalapeno in everything we ordered, except for the guacamole and the kids' meals. But that may just be our taste.  On the bright side: Our waiter was great, and the service was fast.   The kids loved it too!  My only truly negative comment is that there seemed to be way more hostesses than needed (3+ on a Sunday afternoon) , to the point that they would rather stand around socializing than bring people to their tables. And the girl who originally greeted us was sitting off to the side on a bench with a giant make-up kit, putting on her make up, not even acknowledging guests, when we left. Very unprofessional.

JQ5wL98g1ZW8cn_LXLY86A.text: Chuy's is a Texas favorite! If you're looking for a laid back atmosphere, great margaritas, ice cold beer and Tex-Mex fare you can't do much better than Chuy's!

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. The best margaritas!

urteImK7uQynRpmiEiCkkQ.text: Tasted good going down but my wife and I spent the night getting sick from it. I feel miserable today.

dd-9tzAOtOtq3F5yAU2v1A.text: I waited until our 3rd visit to leave an honest review. First time was around opening, they were trying real hard but lots of errors with order and very slow service. Food was decent though and figured we would come back. 2nd time was a bit worse on the food side, lots of semi warm stuff and average service. Came back yesterday for dinner for 2 and same slow lousy service with a waiter who was very clueless to the menu and an actual sense of service. The food here is just poor IMO. Nothing fresh at all in any way, except the chips and salsa. Prices are decent which is the only saving grace. You can do much much better for your dinner plans in my opinion.

FtUoBtDbel4EX8MFP_eqdA.text: I am a regular at Chuy's!  We do Chuy's at least once every 2 weeks (mainly because I live in the area).  My favorite is their Fajita Chicken Burrito with Queso.  As a starter, I always order queso to go along with the fresh chips.  The service is always good and I never have to wait too long to be seated.  Also, the strawberry margarita is really good!

df9JLUGtP3kBJP7DFao08Q.text: I have been going to chuys since south park days, but every time I go back it seems to be less desirable. The newer Waverly location is just bad. Since it has opened it has been slow service with really average at best food. Even the New Mexican martini has suffered. Save yourself the dissatisfaction of a poorly run bad TexMex experience and eat elsewhere. Hopefully something decent will occupy this space because this chain won't last under it's current direction.

UjmlVPZHI1UQNSsfGVVrZw.text: We visited Chuy's the first week it opened and they were still working through the kinks.  Service was slow and food was kind of blah.  We have visited several times since and have been more impressed with each visit.  Seating was prompt and service was awesome.  The food has been delicious, and we always leave stuffed!  Can't wait to go back!

y_HSCXR1l-ftrtbELDaE0w.text: Waited forever for people who came in after me to get seated. The hostesses are idiots very disorganized. There were four of them who sat around and socialized and texted rather than seat people. Food isn't very good either. Would never come back or recommend.

LoWXQHFilc_voJQje-rXPQ.text: Horrible experience. Service sucked. Food sucked. I'm usually a very patient patron because I work at a restaurant and I know how things are but this was seriously one of the worst eating experiences I have had. Taco Bell is better than this place.

U3q5ukAlf0oMAGTnC4dq4w.text: Absolutely the worst food and restaurant experience ever. I could buy microwave or Taco Bell that is better. Staff has no management direction. Pitiful. Do not know how these people are in business. I honestly tried to think of a worse experience and could not come up with one!!! Awful, pitiful, untrained and unprofessional staff!!!!

Bnirv5w0Ff0R7WnX0HmeGQ.text: We love this fresh Tex-Mex joint! I grew up in Arizona and California so this is different than kind of Mexican food. It's much more fresh and has lots of great flavor. We love the appetizer platter and we love the boom boom enchiladas. We've always had great service - everyone that works there is so pleasant and I feel like that's a rare thing these days! We will continue to make the 30 minute drive out here for our favorites, not to forget the creamy jalapeno sauce and the homemade tortillas. Here's to hoping we get one closer to us in Huntersville!

-7-sJShm-BO0hHpteZDpWQ.text: It's our first time and will be our last. It took so long to be seated and then you need to wait for the food.  The food taste bland or tasteless . I rather eat in Taco-Bell or Chipotle. The service was not bad thats why I gave two stars.   I'm so disappointed, I will never come back.

LESQhPG8gDDYnonx1DsZPg.text: I love Chuy's! Great chips! Good food! Big portions! I recommend it to friends.

G_n97-8zVYsQjKFHxiPiZw.text: If I could rank this below 1 I definitely would.  Whoever your employee was taking take out orders last night was very rude to my kids who were trying to place an order.  Unacceptable, how they were treated by the employee last night. Period.

lmRz0Fq4LAj0mZjUXbR13A.text: Not one of the best Mexican restaurant I have ever eaten at but it was pretty good just pretty good.

fkefv-GWwkv96wmVRbHpHg.text: WAY TOO LOUD!!!!  Music is so loud you cannot talk.  Ridiculous!!  Watered down margaritas, food lousy.  Service, slow.   We will not be back.

JhNvnXMrTo3PHtWBHajZCA.text: this is the best restaraunt ever. their creamy jalepeno is sooo good and so is their queso. i could eat here every day. their tres leches cake is huge and so so so good

ILbrl3k7893lPMtaTXeFHA.text: Update: We had the pleasure of meeting the general manager, Dominique, who has promised to address the professionalism issues we encountered today. I am very please with his attentiveness and commitment to make sure his customers are treated well.  Today, a week later, we went back and the service was horrible. There was no one on our side of the restaurant, only our table and another table. The hostess was wonderful and fetched our chips for us. A waiter or waitress did not come by for ten minutes to take our drink order. This isn't acceptable for how slow they were. To make things worse, a waiter and waitress were whispering right in front of our table trying to figure out who had us. I finally spoke up and let them know we had been sitting there for 10 minutes. The waitress, maybe she's new, but she would forget everything. She forgot the straws, my order did not have the guacamole I asked for, she hardly checked up on us, and our drinks were never refilled. I'm really disappointed that our second visit was subpar. Somebody needs to increase Madison's hours, because she is the best waitress in that place. I'm sad we couldn't have her again today.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Notice how empty it was. Absolutely no reason for the horrible service.

NfRYSVAfVTyqEwGUFkmxEA.text: Retro, energetic and fun. Chuy's is a blast from the past.   Kara, our server, was very good and patient with us newbies. The Chips and salsa starter is pretty tasty. The chips were warm and very light. And the salsa has a nice little kick.   I was hungry so I went with the chicken burrito. With burritos, you can pick your sauce. I'd sugguest taking the sauce your online ahead of time so you don't hold others in your party up. There are several, maybe five or six to choose from. Kara had to help me.  I went with the deluxe tomatillo sauce. Excellent choice. It was a creamy white sauce; I wasn't in the mood for a red sauce after salsa.   Burritos are HUGE! They come with a choice of rice. I selected Mexican rice. The dish was very tasty. It was just too large even for my hunger status. I probably finished about 3/4 of it before waving the white flag.

ow_YNlWhV6ynT4v9EGxj0Q.text: Wow this place blows all the places I have eating. What a fun place to eat.  They have a huge menu to choose from.  Huge drink selection also. Definitely see one go to it!

g8YDSVN14C14qKWWHiYEgQ.text: I am a convert. We did not care for the Southpark location because the service was always terrible. In this location (which we have been to maaaaany times) we have always had excellent service. Not just ok service, but excellent service.   We love the queso! We have to order queso every visit. The refried beans are the best anywhere and the homemade tortillas are incredible. We just love Chuy's!!  My only complaint is the noise. They really, really need something to help muffle some of the noise. When it's busy, it can seriously be difficult to hear the people at your table.

KC0vk-JsAUNoIuA6MRMRXA.text: This is Donald Trump style Mexican food. Let's make mexican food great again.bland food dont eat the chicken if you want flavor. I dropped 15 dollars for lunch which is sad all in itself. Which leaves me with the conclusion that this is a Donald trump style Mexican restaurant. No flavor and cost way to much.

ilCAE4rfaaQl6m2HSXBscQ.text: Food was on my menu, napkins and table before I was able to even order. The food was ok when I got it. The ambiance was cute. Theme park version of a Mexican restaurant. Higher prices than more authentic ones. Less food..... Basically, I wasn't impressed.

bh702OhTLLZvEvNxO__YnQ.text: Ok - If all you want are drinks and chips then this is a good place. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME WITH THE FOOD. Over processed, Americanized Mexican food with little taste, smothered in sauces designed to cover up the fact that the kitchen has no clue how to serve good food. Ambiance is fine and service was also par but we both had hearty appetites and left half our plates. I struggled to give this more than one star to be honest!

oK5GtrLsdqk0T3_awq7k0A.text: So greasy. Chuy's used to be good when it was in South Park but it really went to the trash when it moved locations. Service was terrible also. Won't go back again- which is sad because it used to be our weekly spot back in South Park

AWpa1VHT7naXVwXaTY4dJg.text: I love Chuy's.  I like the salsa the best and even come get it for carryout frequently.  It really is one of the best salsas I've tried in a long time.    I followed this restaurant from South Park to its new Waverly location.  I usually get a la carte tacos because they are the best deal for me, since I don't like beans or rice.  The tacos are really good.  The meat (ground  beef) is full of flavor and the shells are crisp and delicious.  All of the insides are fresh.    The service is awesome.  The staff greets you at the door and makes you feel right at home.  The restaurant, being brand new, is extremely clean and well organized.
