Ltmdp4XCwO_5_-B1-_6JLA.text: Chuy's Food is Excellent! While the service is sometimes a little lacking I give extra credit for the quality of the food! The chips are fresh and hot and super thin....I mean so thin that I'm sure if I eat 2 baskets of them it's lower calories than the other restaurants....Right  They have the best grilled chicken and the ground sirloin is excellent as well. Thanks for moving down to South Charlotte! South Park's Loss!

eXbpO0l50ZR-9dm9fM38rA.text: First time here. Food was good. The drinks were good but pricey. We sat outside and it was accommodating. Our server was exceptional. My wife had the fajitas and I had the stuffed peppers. Both were good and the portions were good. I would recommend.

OoKSCdRYF4G9PWv97B3AUQ.text: Food is good but the service is worst ... we had bug on our place ... manager came and he is like because door is open it come in ... so just be careful about the service

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States

P3Xqj4x2IyDQCcdoUrXQPA.text: This my favorite Mexican restaurant. The food was fresh, fast, flavorful and affordable. The waitress was polite and attentive. I had the Baja fried fish tacos and a swirl frozen margarita. Delicious! Cost $19.46 with tax.

naYY6QY3VJMc9KmP3fFmbA.text: Went for early dinner.  Our waitress was really nice and provided great service.  The chips and salsa was very good and the margaritas was good.  But unfortunately everything after that was not good.  Good thing I was satisfied on chips and salsa because my chicken burrito was awful.  The food came out hot, but just lacked flavor all around.  Chicken I so dry!   I was disappointed. They really need to revamp recipes or monitor to see if they are being followed.  I couldn't eat my food. My son didn't eat his and my husband ... well he was hungry and ate it but complained the whole time of how awful it was.    Another thing that threw me off was I told them I had a cheese allergy.  My plate arrived and under the wilted salad garnish was dry stuck on cheese.  Made me think. Did they spill a blob of cheese by accident or was this what didn't come clean from the last user.  Just weird as it was completely covered with the lettuce and salad. Maybe it was on purpose. I couldn't eat after that.   We won't be back, unless we just want drinks, chips and salsa.  That's what I recommend.

hG3HrskGULE_viskKMF1rw.text: Am visiting from Florida and went to dinner at this Chuys in Charlotte, NC. I see these restaurants everywhere but haven't eaten at them. The hostess was not friendly at all which gave a bad first impression, however the waitress was very friendly and catered to all of our needs efficiently. The food was great and the sauces were amazing. The waitress gave plenty of sauce and even offered some to try with the chips. $5 margaritas are a great deal as the other drinks were a little pricy.

8FU17kkbyZKB3U5iVkbd5Q.text: I left a pretty tough review before, as we have seen a decline in service of late. However, the new restaurant manager reached out and graciously asked for me honest feedback. I'm so impressed! The management cares, and that will lead to a great restaurant. Bravo!

DzRNH0N1e0n3rJwWpZbMvg.text: The food was super salty and mediocre at best. I'm sure we will be up half the znight trying to quench our thirst. We tried to order queso that we have had before.  After 2 tries of some form of queso  we gave up and never got what we wanted. The waitress was nice enough,  but did bring us our check without asking if we wanted anything else.   We were not looking for 5 star dining but for the amount we paid, we expected better.  We wont be returning.

fMqLAbZlCeMNEGujxyGdFQ.text: Second visit to this chain. Surprisingly both visits were really good. First time in cascades near DC And now in CLT Off Providence rd. Tasty and efficient. I'm a half Breed Mexican/European that cooks my own food so I have to say pretty good overall. Everything looks and tastes fresh!

R_Mi7v_bRsoTDs2uaUfM1w.text: Wife and I ate there twice in last 30 days. 1st visit, service terrible waited 25 minutes and had to ask manager to get waiter to take our order and the place was not busy. Food was not good, bad experience! 2nd visit, was in the area and we tried it again, waited 10 minutes for waiter and another 25 minutes before food came out. Food not good at all and waiter was rude, dumped a refill of chips in tray with a large scoop and most went on the table. Had a friend with us this time just a bad experience overall. That's it... never eat there again.

GohsC_uorGbJTd-TtxH0fA.text: I have given this place three tries, and I've been sorry each time. The chicken flautas I ordered were decent but the rice and beans were tasteless and seemed old. The chips are light & crispy, but the salsa is just so-so.    What bothers me the most at this location is the lack of cleanliness on the menus, tables, and ledges.  (Yet, they'll sweep right next to you while you're eating!  Just let me enjoy my meal in peace.)  I just can't look past the sticky/wet menus and dead flies in the windowsill.   Service was good tonight but has been horrible in the past. Team members don't smile and seem like they're just trying to get out of there.    Just disappointing.

Esteb7nWqiE5PDpxZeegkA.text: Bring a photo of your dog (in a frame) for a ANY FREE appetizer on the menu! My husband and I come here every other week for their Wednesday $10 fajita special. You walk into this place and feel like you're in a modern art museum. There are hundreds of pictures on the walls, and the restaurant features a small homage to Elvis and Chiauiaas. So cute! I highly recommend the fajitas - my husband and I usually split the fajitas for one and end up with leftovers.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dogs everywhere!
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bring a photo of your dog in a frame for a free appetizer!
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States

cDOQa5lsWlscGnTSa0dgiw.text: Okay, I had heard so many people say how good this place was when it was announced, so obviously had to try it.  Been there a couple times and tried various items from the menu.  All I can say is not impressed.  The staff are friendly enough, and service is good, however, the food is just bleh, maybe a notch above Taco Bell.  Pretty disappointed.   This location has tons of seating both indoor and out, and is conveniently located in Waverly where parking is decent.

yx1hX4_qsKE3GD1Oac0s5g.text: I was not happy with the veggie enchiladas, they were bland and no flavor.  But the cheese dip and chips were very good

Jii-ZlL4akFpnir68s53fg.text: I have given this restaurant two tries. And have been completely and utterly disappointed each time. The last visit I literally had a panic attack and vowed never to return.   The first time we went, we were a party of 5. It took an hour to get seated and an hour after ordering to get our food. We had no intention of being there for the whole night but we were stuck. And then when we got our food, our friend's burrito took another 15 minutes. My friend didn't want to cause a scene, so we didn't say anything about it even though a good manager or waiter would have taken that off the bill. However our waitress was the most unobservant human on the globe, so she probably didn't even notice.  Despite that, the food was pretty good. Very Americanized mexican food, lots of cheese, which we liked!   Second visit we went for lunch, just me and my husband. We put our name in and the hostess told us 15 minutes. After 30 minutes, we went back to the hostess stand to ask what was up. Some guy (manager) started laughing at the hostess and told her you gave them a dead buzzer! They seated us right after with no apology. Whatever, I didn't really care that much about that. They sat us in the tiniest booth ever right in front of a huge 12 people party with at least 4 babies screaming their little heads off. They were literally 1 foot away from me. I couldn't even breathe it was so loud and tight. And then the sun was beaming through their blinds and blinding me, making me regretting forgetting sun glasses. Whatever. I don't care, we finally got our food!! ... but it was wrong. They got both of our burritos wrong, So they took them back and we waited another 20 minutes and finally got our food. But at point, we were exhausted and I wanted to leave so bad.... the manager was sweet and comped our food but the experience was truly awful. Oh and for the love of god, stay away from the beans.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States

UDeKGSL2B6wQDuuK4NpjlA.text: Wasn't a fan of Chuy's thought the chicken tortilla soup wasn't too good thought it could be better it has a great location.

GBGphpgAtRVhYhWIELC7uQ.text: My wife and i had previously passed by Chuy's on several occasions frequenting other restaurants in Waverly.  My wife had a desire for chips and salsa so we decided to check out Chuy's. I could decide between the Chuychunga(steak) and a taco salad. My wife ordered the taco salad so i went with the chunga. I was deeply disappointed.  It was pretty dry and it was supposed to come with queso that was missing. The flavoring was bland and very lacking. The plate included mexican rice where the serving size probably would have sufficed for our 2 year old. There was no sour cream on the side with the smidget(country term) of lettuce and salsa that garnished the plate.  My wife enjoyed her taco salad so it wasnt a disaster but as far a return visit...Negative. The service was ok. The waitress was nice but she was pretty absent the entire meal. She came back once after i was half way through my meal and at that time i had to ask for more sprite as my cup was completely empty. I wouldnt return nor recommend Chuy's but i can say I've tried them.

to9QDGvttLyisaH-KGxFHw.text: Im a fan more so of the playful vibes this place gives off  versus the food! The area first of all let me say is everything where it's located.The bright colors on the outside draws you to want to come in and try it out so i did. Im giving up on eating out at Mexican restaurants that aren't  authentic, i wanted to give it another try. Staff was more than friendly but i don't feel like this is a place i would frequent again. I ordered the chicken stuffed avocado. Pretty tasty it was but it left this weird after taste in my mouth. Would recommend anyone to at least give them a try for i only tried one dish and again it was great but wasn't authentic.

g5NLEG-YmgCOHE1l60ZDgA.text: I was not highly impressed, especially for the prices. There are plenty other Mexican restaurants that offer the same food for better pricing. I had a lot of friends rave about this place, and now I might have to re-think their opinions on everything. I would tell people to stop in if they were hungry or if it was convenient, but not go out of their way to eat at Chuy's.

ykXRJKgTrhwaNY0ekU5aLw.text: Da best food Eva!!!!!!!!!!!!!  i love you chuys ... you make my life complete ... get the chalupa ... u won't regret it

2psqhmWDx7skdNguFxvv9w.text: We come to Chuy's all the time! Our all time favorite server is Cam- he's just fantastic and really should be the first pick for a restaurant manager or training manager because he's fabulous.  The food is always good - our go to selections are the ponchos nachos or chicken fantastic and the stacked enchiladas are also really good. Arnold palmers are great also.

yq5u1oW-NJJAc_t5x4Z3JA.text: Blech. The food is AWFUL. Greasy, salty, stale... just horrible. We ordered a "chuychanga" after being told it was great, but it's awful. My son ordered a cheeseburger and his bun was rock hard stale. My daughter quesadilla was greasy and wet.  The fajita beef tasted like steed meat that had been cooking all day and broke down into a beef mush.   I would come back and try again, but everything was so awful, I probably won't bother.   The one star is because the server was adorable and kind, and the place is super cute with dogs everywhere. Come for happy hour for chips and salsa and margaritas, but don't go any further!!! I'm already sorry.

DyCcY6TVbQvFfmWZKRWLGA.text: We ate at Chuy's  for lunch today. We were seated outside today very promptly. Our server was attentive. The fajitas, chile relleno, beans, rice, chips were all very good. The manager came by and talked to us and asked us about our experience. He was very nice to check on us like that. We will be back soon. Thank you!

O8gIPRkPnC07SOou087pAg.text: Food was good, as usual, but service and drinks were not good. Ordered the Perfect Margarita, not sure that is what I got.  No Patronage (I have these every time I come).  We also tried a Tito's Cherry Limeade. No lime included, no lime flavor, very sweet.  Just below average drink. We were left without water at multiple points and our original drinks came after our appetizer was already eaten. Waitress could care less about serving people and was indifferent towards us all of the time.  Food took forever. Disappointing experience.

6GEo0lv-WzOb9Kqcg61v9Q.text: It was just OK. Nothing special or authentic tasting to me. You could do better with any local Mexican place.

0Ltmvb2SqBGu70Amewf2Zw.text: Food was good service was not on par the waiter mixed up my wife's and I drinks up she is diabetic can't have sweet tea but easy fix other then that would have gave 5 stars

QOd4EkpoYUusLIxDOuUZJg.text: Fast food on a plate. The food was marginal at best I ordered the burrito which I knew would be spicy but  it wrecked my palette and I could not eat any more. I did not think I would have to ask for water but you obviously do and with the slow Service it became a miserable experience. I will take some responsibility for the spicy order, but it won't make up for the fact there is no other reason to return. There are better places close by.

zCdo0psMvWkHu1wwaXlVXA.text: We just ate there for the first time.  It was kind of expensive for some pretty tasteless food.  I had the classic Tex-Mex enchiladas (onion and cheese).  It had no taste.  I tasted mostly the dough in the tortilla. There was a sauce and I think that's how they flavor their foods - with sauce.  Even the refritos were tasteless. My daughter had fish tacos with slaw.  There was barely any slaw.  There was basically just a hunk of battered fish in a taco.  The best thing I can say was their guacamole was good.  But, for over $30, I expected better.  I won't be back.

XATh-BqNLVldum6Aw1Un9A.text: i like the food it's okay but their service isn't that great 6/10 wouldn't recommend and they do not give the drinks or food out fast enough it takes a long time

mkl_cu2YrVOTZeqBfBOSew.text: Can you get better Mexican food? Yes. You can. But Chuy's is a great "Tex-Mex" option even from a chain resturant.   Make sure you grab a cup of their Creamy Jalapeno Cilantro Dip. It's great for chips, on top of your fajitas or rice!   I prefer Fajita's. Honestly, you can't mess them up too badly. It's great the amount of sauce options you can have.   Their chips and very light and not greasy, which makes this one of my favorite spots to go.   We've never had poor service but we've only ever gone at lunch time.

2KgmOT9qeipxFOnxJPacBQ.text: The salsa is awesome and the chips are light, fresh and are not oily!  I have tried the soft shell tacos as well as the hard shell though both are good, my preference is the soft shell. The tortillas are freshly made, delicious and they are a large part of my choice for the soft tacos.  Both dishes are served with the requisite beans and rice, both well prepared and tasty.  Soft tacos are also served with guacamole ~ another taste treat!  My only objection is to the noise level.  The restaurant offers a military discount and expresses their gratitude for the veterans service.  To an old Vietnam Veteran this courtesy means the world to me!  This restaurant deserves your consideration when looking for a quality Tex-Mex meal!

2378-wQ8EsOgcO_8Jq07cA.text: Went with friends for dinner . Crowded and cozy place . Ordered for four of us and after a long time when we did not get our order we said to the waitress - " we have been waiting for long ". Shockingly the answer we got was - " All others are waiting too. "  And when we said "Alright " she says "Great , cool ". Firstly her answer was rude and secondly what was cool about it ? Did she not get a hint that we were annoyed at her rude reply ? She was teenager so I can understand where the "Cool" part was coming from . Food - Was okay.. I ordered a veggie quesadilla .

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quesadillas

H3Ss5bF7HPQUcwN4t_dX3A.text: I've been wanting to eat here for a while now! I suggested this place to my family & we went on a Sunday at 6pm. The waitresses were extremely nice & great atmosphere but it took 1 hour and 15 minutes JUST to get our food! We were full from chips and dip & glad we did because our food wasn't good AT ALL! We were so disappointed that we wanted to ask for our money back but didn't want to seem like we were complaining  I won't be back

1AROZwpT8kbdTjwuT-FG0Q.text: I always thought this place was a pretty cool spot to grab a bite with the family.  I'm a sucker for the pictures of the dogs all over the bar area.    The food was good, overall.  I have the stuffed Avocado which was stuffed with a cheese and supposedly chicken.  I couldn't tell there was any chicken however, the cheese was plentiful.  The avocado was breaded and fried which I could have done without.  Anyone that knows me knows I am an avocado feen and I prefer mine old school - no frills, no sauces, no distractions.  I'm not complaining about it because I clearly knew what I was ordering.  I liked the sauces and the margarita was well made.  The margarita tasted like it was scratch made.  I didn't see if it was or not by DJ Toots or T Crush or whatever the bartender calls himself did a good job.  He was a little mouthy and dropped a few vulgar bombs while telling a coworker a story but I was in the bar section so I didn't think much of it.  I'd definitely go back and recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wall of pictures at the Bar at Chuy&#39;s.

C5IU-31UK3hqrdlWq1ar5A.text: My sister love this place so she brought me here since I just relocated to the area.  I noticed Tex Mex which I haven't seen in a while.  I've traveled around the world especially to Texas and fell in love with Tex Mex back 20 years ago.  First the salsa was definitely fresh, she also asked for the jalepeno dip and I ate that more than the salsa.  We ordered frozen margaritas which were not too strong but that was expected at $5 for the special.  I ordered a drink and a half and didn't even have a buzz.  My sister got the chicken quesadilla and added jalapenos and it was so good.  We also ordered dessert which was awesome.  We noticed there was a free nacho bar and lots of pictures of dogs on the wall.  Our waitress was awesome.  I enjoyed her!  She was there when we needed her and very friendly...  I'll personally return to this location.

AZeEYC9E4Y_NXmZYUQNfKA.text: Disappointed. We sat and waited for 10 minutes past the time we were told. When we got home, I discovered they left out the salsa, sour cream, etc. When I looked at the steak I was really disappointed. I'm posting a picture; it looks like they reduced the portion size. This is the second bad experience we've had from take out recently.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is the fajita for 1. They seem to have reduced the size.
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. 10 minute drive home - guacamole was already black.

Nrw_ogRoXCWcu6DrTB8aXg.text: Came here for a girls night. I had a margarita and tacos. All were delicious. Our waiter was awesome. Super attentive while being super busy. He made sure we were all happy with everything.

TgdHa1i0P519W_G7H3mq6Q.text: First time trying Chuy's.  Not overly impressed yet not too disappointed. Their Tex Mex offerings were creative, more so than the typical.  I chose the stacked enchilladas made with blue corn tortillas.  Was very happy with my choice.  Service was very good - our waitress was very attentive to keeping the chip baskets filled.  The chips and sauces were a highlight.  Super thin and crispy and interesting dipping a to along with.  I order a frozen strawberry margarita, nothing to write home about the best I can say is that it was a nice fruity drink...minus the salt which was a bit surprising.  If you're thinking of trying it out, bring them the framed pic of your furry family member, they'll pop it up on the wall and give you a free appetizer!

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Entryway

Vj4rrkg8_OnJ8qOvVRnzlw.text: Chuy's is not your typical Mexican restaurant. First of all, it is Tex-Mex. which in my experience has usually meant Mexican food for the "gringo ". And while some of that may be True here, the food was better overall than say on the border or the like. That being said, Chuy's could make some small changes that would make a big difference. Firstly, and most importantly, why in the world would you not have any beers on draft? Bottles only? Really? Next, you would think that on cinco de mayo you would have some great food and drink specials right? Not so much. 5 dollar queso or guacamole and dollar off Dos Equis bottles. I asked for a spicier salsa option and was surprised to be offered Tabasco. I've been to Texas, heck I was born in Texas. We like our salsa spicy. Salsas were neither Tex or Mex. I must say that they did have some spicier sauce options for burritos and enchiladas but those were for covering not dipping. I gave Chuy's 3 stars instead of two for the reasonable prices. As you can see from the picture of my entree, I got my monies worth for 11 bucks. It was also nice that the kids meals came with a drink and desert. It just wasn't enough to make me want to run back anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combo #1

SolEpToyPYz3aHBOgvW92Q.text: Menu was decently large. Lots to choose from.  Food was very good. That's the end of the pros. We were seated and waited 11 min before our waitress showed up. Took our drink and food order. 35 min for our food to get to us. It was a Saturday night, so not really complaining there. Once our food got out, we realized we didn't have any cutlery. Waited and waited before our waitress came back around.  Finally asked for some. About 5 min later, another waiter came by and said Sorry, we are out of silverware. But you can just use these. And set down plastic cutlery in bags with a napkin and I think salt/pepper.   I was like I'm NOT going to eat a $15 per person meal with plastic. I want silverware. So we sat for 35 min (no exaggeration) before I saw someone in the back bagging up silverware. I figured our waitress would bring it out. Nope. I had to track her down again and ask for some. By this time our food had cooled down a good bit. I would have figured someone would have just hand washed 2 sets and brought them out instead of what did happen. Sheesh.   Like I said, food was pretty darn good. Wasn't impressed with the portion size I received either. Guess this place is just a one visit show for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Plastiware that was brought out to me like this is a damn taco truck at the fair.
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chika-Chika-boom-boom.

P0dasgIbOtzBulT72Nq9cA.text: Cool little restaurant. I went late night got some food to go. Drinks are good at the bar and staff is cool. All of my to go food was cold. You can tell it was the end of the night none of the food was freshly cook. That's my fault for not checking before leaving. Cold caso was the worst tho lol. Again I blame me for not checking. From what I heated up and tasted it won't bad. Give it a try. If you get Togo and it's late just check food. All in all I would try again.

tcxfzuAGxPZ31ib9TNO2_A.text: I love this place. I was first introduced to Chuy's at it's origin - Austin, TX. My sister moved there and every time I come to visit, she makes sure we at least eat here once.   My favorite dish there is Chicka Chicka Boom Boom. Pulled chicken in tortilla smothered in green sauce (boom boom sauce), rice, beans, tomatillos and jalapenos.   Drink of choice: Tito's Cherry Limeade..........Tito's Vodka another Austin staple. (if you like Sonic's Cherry Limeade, this is your adult version)  Always get the queso with the chips. I do like the salsa the chips come with. I often mix queso with the salsa.  Atmosphere: It's eclectic, it's loud, it's Elvis - in True Chuy fashion. I still don't know what Elvis has to do with all this, but there was a shrine in the back where we sat.  Service: We got seated quickly on a saturday night. Seems like it's a go-to place for family dinners. Lot's of families / groups there. Staff is quick and friendly.  Parking: Again, we went there on a Saturday night, parking was packed. Encountered a jerk that was racing to find the next available parking spot going 90 mph. So maybe try to avoid the "rush" hours?  Will definitely be back here.....the Chicka Chicka Boom Boom tasted just as good as I remember from my times in Austin.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Elvis combo comes with queso chips and a softshell beef taco
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Elvis combo
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicka Chicka Boom Boom, my faveeee

QS-U9PvY_KiJI8piHkaV8g.text: Just nooo!!!  Had an early dinner on Friday and do not plan on going back! I had the Friday special of the fat daddy enchiladas and let me just start with there was nothing "fat" about them!! They were just regular enchiladas and sadly lukewarm, even though the restaurant was pretty empty. The chicken inside was white and didn't have seasoning, tasted like it had been boiled while the tortilla was dry and felt more like a cracker even though it was topped with cheese sauce (asked for queso instead of the green sauce it normally comes with)....I couldn't even finish one!  This Tex-Mex is more like the McDonalds of Mexican food...if you've had the real deal and love flavour, this is not the place for you!  Our waitress was friendly, chips were fresh and jalepeno sauce (with a ranch base) that came with the chips was pretty good. The salsa was fresh but bland. I visited their SouthPark location way back and hated the combo plate I ordered. I thought to give them another chance but that was a big mistake!

mYMrYN2LfbGHjtzFy597tA.text: Really, really bad service.  We asked for a drink menu...never got one.  Had no idea how the "nacho bar" worked...and were never told.  Also took a really long time to place our order.  Before getting our food...we were SURE that we wouldn't be back.    But...we got the food...and it was actually pretty good! We had the chicken fajitas on the "fajita special" night, and will be back again for the fajitas!   Word to the wise - don't expect stellar service!

oGz62L0kznpEDfIZ2IuEqw.text: We went on a Sat afternoon around 3:00, and it wasn't really crowded at all. Walking through the restaurant, my husband thought that the floor could stand to be cleaned again and the sides of several tabletops needed to be wiped down more thoroughly.   Once seated at the table, the server was quick to greet us. We both enjoyed our meal, and their chips are my favorite type: thin and crispy! The salsa that came with the chips was really, REALLY good. I had 2 chili rellenos: roasted chicken and ground sirloin, that came with the usual refried beans and rice. Normally I don't care for rice but decided I would give it a try. It was seriously good and I'll get it again.  We will be back, for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. The best chili rellanos ever: ground sirloin, and oven roasted chicken with excellent beans and rice.
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. The lamp at our table!

RQDKmtbj4Idv8Gjd4mrtOQ.text: One of my favorite places. The wait is never long and the food (and plates) is always hot! They have very spicy to mild options so there's something for everyone. The staff is attentive and friendly most of the time. Have only had one bad experience with a waiter and I've been here several times. I highly recommend it for Mexican food.

0FDehxS75ppk-D0v3unO4w.text: We went today and the food and service was wonderful.  We stopped going for a awhile but after today we will be back....

P9XluKVhqGLb3FYWdGCJJQ.text: The Chuychanga was nicely fried and stuffed with a decent offering of shredded chicken and cheese, then topped with crema and plated with a side of super-smoky charro beans and a classically seasoned pile of Mexican rice.   Sadly, the Shrimp & Cheese Rellenos were so overstuffed with chopped cilantro, you couldn't taste any of the interior ingredients. The fried crust on the exterior of the massive Anaheim peppers was freakishly crunchy - almost like Corn Flakes - and peeled off in one giant sleeve of shell-like goodness. Still, the cilantro -packed into the peppers like grass clippings in a lawnmower bag- completely spoiled the dish.   The Elvis Green Chili Fried Chicken saved the day with its quirky deep-fried chicken breast breaded with Lay's Potato Chips and smothered in green chili sauce and a sprinkling of cheddar cheese - certainly a dish worthy of "The Kang"!  The boozy margaritas help wash down the bagged tortillas and watery pico de gallo-style salsa - we were unimpressed with the rather flavorless guacamole.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Elvis Green Chili Fried Chicken - truly fit for &#34;The Kang&#34;!
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Shrimp &amp; Cheese Rellenos was stuffed like a lawnmower bag with too much cilantro.
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Chuychanga was nicely fried and stuffed with a decent offering of shredded chicken and cheese

JURnvzhNtitrXSFH75HN-Q.text: My daughter fro Texas gritted her teeth - the Chooy's there is awful but this was a different spelling and surprisingly good. There were 7 adults, a 2 year old and a baby. But service was prompt and accurate. We could have been given a third table which would have helped. The guacamole was especially good.  It was a combination of pieces of avocado plus mashed, allowing the 3 colors of avocado to shine through. It was not overly spiced and they added chopped tomato on top rather than stir it through which meant it was not watered down. There was a jalapeno dip that was excellent and not too spicy too. The tortillas were extra thin the way I like them. I had quesadillas, and those who had fajitas were pleased. They handled 7 patrons with ease.

e5j95fuhitr3WN6eaCDWKw.text: my family and i absolutely love chuys! every weekend we go out to dinner, and the past few weeks we have not been able to stay away from all the great mexican food they have to offer. the hot thin chips with either the salsa or queso is fabulous, same with the steak or chicken fajitas! i would definitely recommend :)

DJt0SB6mBE5zMBTj7giS5A.text: We had the house margaritas which were on tap and the drink special for the night. Happy Hour came with free salsa, creamy jalapeno dressing and chips. The jalapeno dressing was really yummy and not overly spicy. I had the taco salad with ground sirloin and my friend had the Mexican Cobb salad with chicken. Both salads were large and had great flavor. Not a huge place, but a great spot for drinks and appetizers.

5sbmtfQsShFV2rclrO-mKw.text: This is now our favorite Tex-Mex in town.   Service was good. Good chips (salsa was diced tomatoes but they gladly provided Tex-Mex sauce for me.)   Deluxe chicken enchilada sauce had a heavy sour cream flavor that I didn't like, but the chicken was really good quality white meat.   I've had same meal at On the Border and the chicken was absolutely crap.  Thanks Chuy's, you've won my business.

pGusYHH7LjMUyv7SeJwwfA.text: So glad I did not rely on the Yelp reviews - for once. Instead I asked local friends (I am visiting from out of town) where to meet them for dinner. One friend described Chuy's as amazing so I said great let's go! I was not disappointed. Easy to get to, with friendly greeters at the door, we were seated in a crowded but not noisy main room. Our waitress immediately came by with fresh warm tortilla chips and salsa. My friend asked for their jalapeno sauce which she then brought two of. This is a great sauce in which to dip the tortillas! I enjoyed the house margarita (had to smile when asked for my ID) then ordered the Deluxe chicken enchiladas with mexican rice and refried beans. I also ordered a side scoop of guacamole because well - because! The chicken was tender and moist, wrapped in a fresh tortilla and smothered in that jalapeno sauce - yum. The mexican rice was flavorful and went great with the refried beans. All along our waitress was attentive yet not hovering. I will definitely go back!

bUeRc7lWJ0VA3B12ZLF5ew.text: Quoted 30 minute wait, 1.5 hours later we were stalking tables to try to feed our kids. Food was mediocre, go to la unica for real Mexican, FAST service, and more consideration of your time from hosts.

ig6Bo7DhQ3msteG2shM5zA.text: So, I wrote the home office. They say you'll be contacted shortly....I guess two plus weeks isn't shortly enough. We loved the Southpark location. What a shame they couldn't replicate it at Waverly. We went the first time during their second week after opening. Having been in the business before I put it up to new location, new employees, still working out the bugs. I'll always give a restaurant the SECOND CHANCE. I waited six months...boy was I wrong. The most enjoyable part of our second time was our waitress, the Beer and the Margarita. It started out with Chips so salty I had to slurp up two tall glasses of water. Maybe they were trying to up their Beer sales. Off the Children's Menu the Burrito was tasteless and not even hot enough to melt the cheese. My Shrimp Tacos were so heavily breaded I had to peel the breading off so I could taste the Shrimp! There were six thin slices of Red Cabbage and the Cilantro was crammed on one end of the Taco. My Rice was just two degrees over room temperature. My wife's Stuffed Peppers also had an overabundance of breading. For some reason her rice was hot. My wife had walked over to the free HAPPY HOUR NACHO BAR and came back with a total look of disgust; over picked, crusty cheese sauce and dried out toppings. When our waitress came by with the bill she asked how everything was. I had to be honest and I told her she was great but the food was horrible. She said she would get the manager. I explained everything to him and he apologized. He did the correct thing and comped the food. He also gave me a coupon for three free appetizers and entrees and asked me to give them one more try. I said I would but truth be told...no restaurant gets a third try. I gave the coupon to my sister who fortunately had a good dining experience there.

9UBLdIh7qczg5_YK86Bdzw.text: Love this restaurant and their homemade flour tortillas. The salsa is also really great. The new location is really busy but worth the wait. We regularly go and have the chicken tacos. The pinto beans are a must.

SkDY0nseNVvPnajryQEjMg.text: Great food but completely irritating wait staff.  Tons of servers walking around do everything but bringing you your food and drinks

LITfZoDCYYEvwtv1Indn_Q.text: This is pretty great Tex-Mex food! The chips are thin and crispy, the sauces are great, and I love the enchiladas. Chuy's enchiladas beat your standard Mexican restaurant enchiladas in my opinion hands down. The tortillas are fantastic too, so you won't get a cold corn tortilla with some last minute sauce thrown on top, the sauce actually soaks through. I usually get the Elves Presley Combo and take home a bit over half every time, because it's SO MUCH FOOD. I like that you can get one of each enchilada (beef, cheese, and chicken) so if you haven't tried their enchiladas, it's a good way to try them. I will say that the regular beef tacos are average, but you can ask for some of the sauces to spice them up, and they do come pretty loaded with filling. I think what I like best is that a lot of the offerings have a little kick to them, and you can taste the fresh ingredients. We haven't had any bad experiences with the servers, and everything's been fine for us. Remember, this is Tex Mex you guys! So don't expect authentic Mexican tacos!

MC4hMlMb_y8ji9D0VlEdQw.text: Went to dinner with a girlfriend of min and the wait staff was great, the food was not! The environment of the restaurant felt very 50's Cuban vibe, not Fine Tex-Mex. The experience was great but won't go back, food was not up to par for the price of the food.

c6cQUhZxQCMsMNFOI31RxA.text: First Tex-Mex is supposed to be SPICY PEOPLE! With that said this place is legit. The best Tex-Mex I've had in a long time. Food was great and had plenty of flavor. Restaurant was clean and decorated nice. Staff were great and very nice. We'll be back for sure.

Om0Zhg9LtBvKDzgwSn6ewA.text: While I much prefer the convenience of the old South Park location (this one is practically in the middle of nowhere), I was pleasantly surprised by our experience tonight. The wait was short, around five minutes, and the food was delicious (I recommend the fish tacos or the oven roasted chicken burrito). The real reason for this review though is our waiter Matthew, who was incredible. I have never had more attentive service anywhere. He kept everything topped off, checked on our food, brought the check immediately... His hard work and attention to detail made for a very enjoyable experience and we will definitely be back soon. Thanks, Matthew!

GmP713HoWltBp88sJkULdg.text: Being from Texas and having lived in Austin for years, I can say that Chuy's Tex-mex is legit. Handmade tortillas, queso compuesto and a variety of unique sauces for enchiladas (or chips!) are the pillars of its greatness. And don't forget amazingly fresh tortilla chips and salsa and of course, the dot and swirl margaritas! Stop by weekdays from 4-7 to enjoy the free queso bar- you won't regret it! The fun atmosphere and funky decor works for date night, family night or any night!!

fEevEeWdlJF9gVUbiR_WWg.text: Lackluster.  The food quality was mediocre and the server provided our table an ice-water shower with nary an apology.  I had the classic enchiladas, but found them to be simply two, flat unrolled tortillas with chicken in the middle, covered in unremarkable sauce.  Standard Mexican rice and re-fried beans accompanied.  Nobody at our table of five thought their meal was more than "ok".  The pricing was reasonable, but we did limit additional purchases of drinks and dessert due to the apathetic server.  When I talked to a manager about the poor service and the word-of-mouth reputation Chuy's was developing nearby, he apologized and provided a full voucher for our next meal.  As a result, we will give Chuy's a second chance but we were far from impressed in our first visit.

rGbLLy7GXiD0_UdRd6CJuw.text: Food was good, but the service was terrible. First, when I arrived, there were plenty of tables available on the patio and NO line. I asked for a table on the patio. They said they'd have one cleaned off for me first. This took a good 10 minutes.  When we got to our table, our server was not very engaging.  She did not recommend anything, or come back for a drink order, even though I had told her I might want something other than water, but wasn't sure at the time. She never checked back on drinks.  When our food arrived, we did not have any silverware. We asked for silverware and napkins, and they brought silverware, but no napkins.  A while later, I hadn't seen our server. I saw the host come by, and asked her for some napkins. She said she'd get them for us but NEVER brought them. My wife had to get up and get the napkins herself!  Finally, no offers for dessert, just a question "do you want your check?"  Very poor customer service. This is the third time we have been to this Chuy's. I expect it will be our last.  Oh, the one redeeming attribute? Even though the service was terrible, the food was good.

uojL0eHcpJylo6FVY7XSXg.text: i had heard good things about this place and was excited about its opening near me.  We went when it opened in Dec and had horrible service and food was mediocre at best   i chalked it up to a new opening and figured I would give it settling time.  So we came again tonight.  Waited at least 10 min before being acknowledged.  We were finally brought drinks after 2 servers came to us, 1 beer and 1 margarita.  Took another 5 min and asking where my daughter's coke was before we got it.  Food was ok, not the best but not the worst.  Could have maybe been ok with it and coming back 1 more time.  However, ordered another drink and waited 15 min, 2 servers checking and both said it was coming.  When it was finally brought to me 1 of the servers whispers to me how bad the bartender is and that they are tying to get rid of him.  Proceeds to tell they have had multiple firings for drinking behind the bar.  Needless to say I doubt I will be giving more of my money to this establishment or recommending it to anyone else

DkSYWDwMtEiFrfzWsDscdA.text: This place was TERRIBLE. The tacos tasted like a Greek pita. I would only come if I wanted to eat trash.

2-gCJFuwCMwSOw2mAX9Scg.text: Really sad. This is one of the first restaurants that opened in the new Waverly shopping center and it is completely unacceptable. My husband and I walk in for the first time on Sunday evening and the first thing we notice is the trash in the lobby (dirty styrofoam take out). We don't realize how bad it's really going to get until we're taken to our table by the hostess. With the hostess in front of us, all we see as we walk around the restaurant to get to our table are dirty dishes and trash stacked everywhere on the tables from previous customers. The feeling of filth was only exaggerated by the amount of food on the floor. With much disappointment, we could not bring ourselves to eat here. We explained this to the hostess before leaving and what could have been a manager. Finally, as we are  walking out, we notice that even their doors had the look of not having been cleaned all day, while the two hostesses stand there with nothing to do. Sad for Waverly.

1np5gMFsz_prd6_VEoDMwQ.text: Brittany behind the Bar was fantastic.  She made great recommendations on different margarittas and even gave samples until we found something to our liking.  The Baha Fish tacos were great as well as the chalupas were excellent.  Other than a short wait we had a great time, great music and the Best bartender and service.

9q1VtUr8kKXPq3i0r34qtA.text: I was very disappointed by our first visit to Chuy's in Waverly.   We waited 55 minutes to be seated ( 4 adults,1 child) after being told 30 minutes to start off. Then when we were finally seated we waited 15 minutes until the waitress even came up to take her drink order.  Next, salsa was delivered with no chips and we had not received the drinks yet they arrived about five minutes later.  The waitress then took our order and brought the wrong queso about five minutes later that we sent back.  When the food finally arrived 45 minutes later it was cold and one of our party's salad was not served with the others... We addressed this with the waitress. While we were waiting for her food to arrive about 10 minutes later the waitress comes back and says that she's told the kitchen three times that she was missing the Grilled Chicken Salad but they still have not made it for her so she was sending the manager to our table.  When he arrived he had salad in hand and did not apologize for such the delay.  Very poor service....oh yeah and we had to ask to receive silverware twice.   We will not return

nGMpW2iSMJe3aTtiRv370g.text: Came on Father's Day around 5 pm. We were sat immediately. We ordered the guacamole appetizer. It was good but at the bottom it was all lettuce which we all found strange for an appetizer guacamole. I ordered the Tex mex salad combo with a deluxe quesadilla. The quesadillas were two tiny quesadillas but they were good. Service was good, not excellent. Drinks ran out and the manager came to refill them. Drink orders were wrong. Overall food and service were good.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combo #1
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Taco salad
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Guacamole filled with lettuce at the bottom

_W9pqFu_Pxitrbe0pfkNrQ.text: Love, love, love Chuy's! The food is always consistently good. Don't let 2 star reviews about thin chips or 1 star reviews about servers being busy deter you from checking out this gem. Yep, the chips are thin. They are crispy and amazing that way. Yep, the servers are very busy. They recently opened and that tends to happen with new restaurants.  My only gripe, and it is a small one, is no draft beer. But they have a great selection of Mexican and local beers. They even have some of that yellow water with bud or coors on it if that's your thing. Great service from the bar. Not much of a liquor drinker but the wife loves their skinny margaritas.  I'm so happy that Chuy's is near my house and will definitely be a regular.

WayPYYR1IL6ELwUn9NeVPQ.text: This place is great if you like Tex-Mex.  We ate there at lunch today.  Everyone who worked there was really nice and seemed to be in a great mood, almost like they actually like their jobs.  We started with the Chile Con Queso (YUMMY) our main entrees were the lunch combo #3 and salad/quesadillas combo.  Everything was very tasty.  The only thing missing is a good hot sauce.  We tried their hottest sauce and it was not very spicy.  Can't wait until summer to sit outside and drink margaritas on the patio!

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. #3 Taco and Enchilada
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dinner salad and Quesadillas
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chile Con Queso

mLtdpEoMQ81x1P5ErAtwVQ.text: First time food and drink awesome still new lots of employees tripping over each other. ..that will fix itself as the weed out the non worker's. ..FAMILIES this is Tex Mex so if little taste buds don't want a little heat don't look for a menu change go out fot kiddie food and one day you can eat like an adult again .Had appetizer sampler amazing fresh guacamole some of the best in area ...wife loved her enchiladas and margarita. .will recommend to all in area but again little taste buds may want to wait

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Appetizer sampler

UKf1VAjF5fvcuf24D-S7lQ.text: Just opened down the street from me in Waverly . Very crowded but we had a party of 7 and did get seated fairly quick. The Chips are thin and hot and good ! Table Salsa was fresh and spicy !  Guacamole was lacking and flavoring and mostly chopped lettuce .  The Chili Rellenos were wonderful ! Big and Crisply fried - 2 in the order. I had the Cheese filled ones and I loved them ! Tacos were good, could have had a bit more meat . The Regular Margarita was plain an needed more lime. I will go back again !!  For Tex Mex it was very good !

fS9DsqdcIag089dlTpl9XA.text: I enjoyed this place. Fun retro-designed interior, large portions of food. Cool location as well (in the up-and-coming "Waverly Neighborhood" by Ballantyne). Food doesn't have a "wow" factor but it's still a pretty fun place. I knocked off 1 star for the food being "pretty-good-not-great" and the crappy beer selection. Definitely worth going if you are in the area.

n-v9T72PkHDqVjbqGiObNQ.text: Go for the margaritas. Stick to the margaritas. Nibble on the chips and salsa. Come back home.  Somehow, I always stray from that plan AND regret it. The food is well, it's Tex-Mex chain food. What do you expect?  The service is good and the salsa bar at Happy Hour doesn't hurt. In fact, I bumped up the rating to a three star thanks to the staff and the free salsa bar.

H6SWdpTmlJpb9CWtNrO0fQ.text: Chuy's AKA "Expensive On the Border". It's literally the same restaurant with cheap salsa and really bad service (and a 96 for a sanitation rating).  The bartender makes a nice margarita.

A2gMSAO0ByKyRemmfnzQVQ.text: This may be the worst food in Charlotte.  Actually all of North Carolina.  Perhaps the US.  Run, don't walk away from this place.  To the owners and managers, please close so a real restaurant can open there

jz4qvKy1rv5t4tzBNqBmYQ.text: 80% of the time I order to go, something is wrong. Total garbage. They always miss something or leave something out. It's not hard to double check the order before you bring it out

EBCHQUUACqNe1sZBFrzKJw.text: My husband and I stopped in for lunch. The food is ok nothing spectacular. The guacamole isn't good. It tastes like it is from a jar. The service was awful. The waitress was pleasant she just wasn't good. She didn't refill our drinks and pretty much ignored us the entire time we were there. We won't be back anytime soon. I gave it two stars because the place was clean.

UTHmBkpt08-7E7gs1j-iGw.text: Great atmosphere but I'm I'm not sure why it's called TexMex... there is 0 Tex and 100% Mex. Food is fine , price is fine but just know that the menu is a straight Mexican joint menu

z4ZkFG6ABteKIJe65OuWFA.text: Stomach filler :/.   Can't say more.  Not their fault.  Appears to be a chain / factory produced model.  They can do so much more and better if they made a few tweaks.

EYe_qoTs3wKZ2auiOpIKNw.text: Im from Texas and never found any good Tex mex food till I came here to chuy's people who say it isn't good it's a huge lie I'm from Texas I know the food and this place to the best

ZogtuR2ttgcuHpAMstWsng.text: Well, sometime you try a place and regret it. We thought this would be better than our usual Chipotle and Qdoba. So, so wrong. Our food was cold, tasted stale and old. The location is fantastic and in Waverly -so many good places to go in the complex. But not sure Chuys will make it. Service wasn't on par and just didn't seem like they wanted to be there. Perhaps a rough day but just not for us in the future.

hcmImk-zDlmN4Bq6rA42Ng.text: The service was so slow that we actually got up and left before our drinks came (After waiting for over 20 minutes).  When we looked around us, we noticed that barely any tables actually had their food - just chips.  If it takes over 20 minutes to get a soda after it was ordered, I can only imagine how long it would take for the food to come out.

CRNc0wtSx7ktKX9niO1JNA.text: Chuys is an awesome crossroads between cheap, satisfying food, and great sit-down-restaurant quality. Their sauces stand out as unique from other restaurants, and the creamy jalepeno sauce is reason enough to go in. Order it with your chips, put it on your meal, drink it, whatever. This place is great.

OcS-fzPDBdo7tjGtTB9gvQ.text: Came here with a friend and had worst experience.  The drinks were horrible  and we ordered the Mexican salad and a burrito.  The chicken was dry in the salad and the burrito wrap was doughy.  To make it worst, a server was trying to locate our table to deliver the meal.  An older gentlemen asked us what we ordered and then said 'I got you boo!'  They just lost a customer.  Happy cinco de mayo!

mFGbxaSuDeyFTWOJp3y0Bg.text: We looked forward to going to the new location since South Park had been closed for awhile. We finally went last night. Our server was great but the food was just ok. The food was warm, not hot. The drinks we ordered were very small for $11.

S7DCBeayjHssSJfTXNuzSw.text: I came here twice! The first time was not a great experience. The servers didn't seem focused on working. We saw our server go out to his car with several girls while we were waiting 10 plus minutes for our margaritas. Food was bad, it was cold, dry and my fish was "fishy". I was not upset, I understood they could of had a rough night. So I came back to give them a second chance. Once again poor service and poor food.  Suggestions - Educate and inform staff how to properly run a restaurant. Make sure food is fresh and not dry and pasty. Maybe new management?? I mean idk. I hope others have better experiences.

NGC2OOksaB19eCZsqR7zLg.text: We are from Austin and so have a soft spot and big appetite for Tex Mex, including eating at the original Chuy's on Barton Creek many times.   This location leaves a lot to be desired, bar area is small, dining area smallest of any Chuy's we've ever been to, and the service can be horrendously slow and poor in general. The South Park location was so much better, but also a lot less busy even considering the Cowfish overflow people.   Still, I give this place 5 stars because the food never disappoints. My wife gets the same thing every time, Chicka-chicka Boom Boom. If you like chicken enchiladas and spicy sauce, this is the go-to dish esp with the hatch chile rice, that you can also sub with any meal.   I've ventured all over the menu, my favorite is the chile relleno with shredded chicken. Also the cornflake fried chicken is good, always the big as yo face burrito is a good choice esp if you are hungry.   Hopefully the service improves and the wait gets shorter, sometimes it is as long as 2 hours for a table of 5!  You can always try the open seating at the bar.  With the rest of Waverly slowly opening, I can only hope it improves.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Also ask for the &#34;Sauce Tour&#34; and try them all!
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chile relleno with shredded chicken
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicka-chicka boom boom!

M3mpyrwVKeoPB_RIvK8dSw.text: Great food, drinks and service.  This is our local go to place for good Mexican.  The chips were thin n crispy with delicious salsa.  We always get the queso with ground beef to have with our chips as well.  I highly recommend the fajitas and chicka chicka boom boom enchiladas. Side note, if you like slightly spicy ask for a side of jalapeno ranch.  You can eat this with chips or with your meal.  I wish they sold bottles of this deliciousness!  The perfect margarita was exactly that, perfect.  We had one lime and one mango.  Lastly everything is fresh and waiter was very attentive.  He was working quite a few tables but he moved quickly and stayed on top of things.  Manager stopped by all tables to make sure everything was ok.  Very nice gesture.

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States

wzQhPFr5l5nwDozOmPeKXw.text: Excellent spot for tex-mex selections! The salsa is fresh and the chips are warm. Great drinks, laid back atmosphere and great customer service. The wait was not to long for a Tuesday evening on Valentines Day. We waited for less than 20 minutes. The food came out hot. The drinks were great! They also offer drink specials through the week. This location is new to the area. I would highly recommend Chuy's and plan to go back again. We had a great experience!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combination Fajita beef and chicken! Delicious!!!
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. La Pina Colada! Amazing! Great taste
Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Exterior- Bright lights!

gTOo_2BwPEkwRp4SYfSKiw.text: Stopped in on a busy Friday night, high tops were self sat and we found one right away (people were quickly moving). Staff was AMAZING, attentive and pleasant. Food and drinks were good for the price. Would go back.

KRJUNbG7dOYmLuRj3_SSNQ.text: We've been here a handful of times, and I just don't know why. This last visit will most likely be the last. We ordered drinks at the bar, while waiting for our table. The bartender was very nice. Then we were seated at our table.. and it was just an unpleasant experience. The server, who didn't give us a name, came up after nearly 5 minutes and said "are you ready to order?" Well, no. I would like a water, maybe an appetizer, actually just a little bit of hospitality. His trainee (maybe) brought us chips & water quickly, but don't worry, we were immediately asked again "you ready to order?" Then a different server came by about 2 minutes later, asking the same question.. so we went ahead and ordered. Our server never checked back, except to drop the check, which had his name on it... Andrew. His $20 loss, since we were going to have another margarita. We never saw a manager, until our departure, when he was perched up in the bar area. Overall less than pleasurable experience

LUVuRuJxj9QJhp9zEdJ0xw.text: My first visit and we ordered take out.  While waiting on our food the manager Jeff walked by us over 10 times and never acknowledged or spoke to us. As I recall he never spoke to anyone that walked in the door.  How rude!! Is this what this establishment represents??? The food was so so at best.  I would not recommend this place to an enemy!!

amXbXBm7Fsb4GqQsnBFSoA.text: Chuy's texmex food is very disappointing. The food doesn't have any flavor what so ever. I was highly disappointed. I was looking forward to Spanish restaurant near my house, however it was not to my liking. I will not be back here. I have had texmex before but I have never had it before with little to no flavor.

kUngM6hlBVVhelwpJlnuUQ.text: I was hoping for a good experience.. but, sadly not. Food wasn't that great, and overpriced. Also, I used the valet right outside and when I got my car back, my hood was open! Don't use the valet...

jJgqA1wMbw5BNoHNcvetBw.text: I wouldn't go here. The food was luke warm (when it got here). Total time in and out for three was over 90 minutes. I will say that the chicken and pork tasted like they were made in the store and deserve some recognition for their quality. Need better service and better attention overall. Given all the options in this area, I would consider something else for your time and money.

z9kYRiN_-f40Oho2VF_P8w.text: Stopped here on a whim and so glad we did! We were driving down the road actually going somewhere else for dinner and the sign caught my eye. For some reason switched plans on the fly!  This was our first time at a Chuy's and our waiter did a great job giving us a rundown of the menu. He brought out our chips with salsa and a thing of Jalapeno crime sauce... wow. So good. I ordered the a huge steak burrito that was very very good. The amount of food was insane and I simply could not finish it.  Prices are about what you would expect and just an overall good first experience, no doubt in my mind we will return at some point.

YZhqytQXIoQn81rZFOSbKQ.text: I went to Chuy's Friday night with two other people and the service was absolutely terrible. When we arrived the hostess tried to seat us at a booth that was very small. We asked for a table and moved. The only service we got was the hostess brought the chips and salsa to us. After observing servers and others walking around us assisting others for about 10 mins we decided to leave. Upon leaving I asked for management. He apologize and wanted to take care of us. Now the manager was one of the people we saw looking around and talking with other staff and not serve us. I told him no we didn't come for free food. It was my suggestion to go there because I did like the place. It will be at the bottom of my list.  We went across the bridge to On the Border. The service and food was fantastic.

zOzBqt4KuQnXTdQeh5o6LQ.text: Very good food and service, will definitely be back.  The price on the fajita for 1 was very high considering the small portion, but otherwise no complaints.

xp8j5EiAiol6-2H1710K7Q.text: Let me start out by saying, this place is off the chain!! Super laid back vibe and all of the servers and managers seemed to be really interested in how the customers were doing. Our server, Devin, couldn't be more helpful. She suggested some appetizers but we settled on the quesadillas. They were amazing! The creamy jalapeno dipping sauce was perfect on the chips and quesadillas. Overall it was a great experience and I will definitely be back!

6HrNYMPpT0SHZt0q3ynjQw.text: Was not impressed with the food nor the service... Waited for longer than usual to get simple appetizers, the waiter kept forgetting parts of the order, water, utensils... The place is popular with families, however there were no attempts to make our kids more comfortable/ jokes/ attention. Bland experience overall.

NE1rgu02rGmPcH5RGxwhnw.text: I went here with two friends for a late lunch. It was super! I had a cheese chile relleno and a veggie enchilada.  The chile relleno was phenomenal, the best I have had ever. The jalapeno cream sauce is the one to pick hands down! I asked about it and the waiter brought me some to try.  They had free queso the day we went. James D was our server and he was very attentive and made us feel like we were esteemed guests in his home.  Great representative of Chuy's.  I will def return!

photos.caption: Photo of Chuy's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese chile relleno and veggie enchilada

wGeFrWcjF5-vCU45rBtiRQ.text: Generally speaking, the food is pretty well priced for the portions and I enjoyed the look of the interior. However, the customer service on all ends was a different story. To make it short and sweet, about a week ago my wife and I stopped in the bar for some lunch. The young lady behind the bar was a joy but our sever and the servers that were by the bar were loud and obnoxious. Usually we can tune them out but when you add the stench of skunks/drugs it was too much. Our server Melissa was passive towards us and seemed to be too busy gossiping then taking care of us. Luckily, the food was a good distraction. We will not be back unless for takeout.

wt-5aFSblJOvMFh5s4-8UA.text: The worst. There quesadilla tortilla shells were made of flat bread, so it was like eating a biscuit with Mexican chicken and cheese. Not good at all. My husband said his food was kind of bland. I wouldn't eat there again.

3i0leeg3GN86hkLGwYg61Q.text: Been to the one  in Greenville  but this was nothing like it. Service was slow. Beverage service was slow. Location did not have the fun feel of other places. Food was good though, but our waiter was so bad I would have to give 3 stars.  Love the Greenville location, you guys should go have dinner there and see what you need to do

Slhwu3IN-sOAy_dyXPLJ4g.text: Good run of the mill Mexican food-tried this location instead of Southpark. Same great chips and salsa. The staff was a bit harried but, they just opened so....  Outdoor area to sit and eat/drink. Located in the Waverly complex-this will be a mad house in a few years. Parking lot with multiple other shops and restaurants and apartments.

itveZh30khDYZR8mDS3_xA.text: I definitely won't be back. We sat on the patio on a nice 65 degree night. The chips were the only good thing like people have said. Also, this is the first place I've ever been to that gives you extra spicy salsa with the chips, which I didn't mind but my bf sure couldn't handle it. The queso was meh. It took us a long time to get our drink order then our appetizer ordered. Then we sat with our menus closed for thirty minutes before getting our entrees ordered. Finally when our food did come it was delivered by a manager who said "wow if you can survive sitting under this heater you can survive anything"... from the manager. Yes, we felt like we might need to put on sunscreen, our table was literally hot but at least the Above food warmer made sure our food didn't get cold. Who tests a heater at max level when it's only 65 degrees and doesn't even turn it off after realizing it's burning hot! The food was not so great. Beans were dry, rice hard and dry, cheese enchilada and tacos not great. Burrito bad. They have a lot of work to do.
